content:
Here are three quotes from chapter 3 of The Giver that show Jonas's character development:

1. "For the first time, he heard something that he knew to be music. He heard people singing. Behind him, across vast distances of space and time, from the place he had left, he thought he heard music too. But perhaps, it was only an echo."

This quote shows that Jonas is beginning to develop a deeper appreciation for things that he has never experienced before, like music. He is starting to realize that there is more to life than what he has been taught in his community.

2. "But the future was what lay ahead, and he wanted to take the journey, even though he did not know what it might bring."

This quote shows that Jonas is becoming more curious and adventurous. He is willing to take risks and explore new things, even if it means leaving his comfort zone.

3. "The thought gave him a feeling of pleasure. He had never felt anything like it before. It was fun to be out in the evening, out in the night, with the wind, moving fast, with no worries or cares."

This quote shows that Jonas is beginning to experience emotions that he has never felt before, like pleasure and joy. He is starting to enjoy the simple things in life and appreciate the beauty of nature.
